definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: A distressed mistress has suppressed the witnessed stiffness of the harness.
sentences.chinese: 一個痛苦的主婦抑制了有旁證的玩具的硬度。

sentences.english: I'll call what the circumstantial evidence is so far indicating the "Double Whammy" A one, two punch.
sentences.chinese: 我會稱呼迄今爲止的旁證，爲“雙重打擊”。

sentences.english: The image offers circumstantial evidence that a young star is being born inside the placental cloud.
sentences.chinese: 該圖片提供了一顆年輕恆星正從胚胎雲中誕生的旁證。

sentences.english: The jury will not convict on circumstantial evidence alone.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團不會僅僅根據旁證來定罪。

sentences.english: You can't convict a man of a crime on circumstantial evidence alone.
sentences.chinese: 不能只靠旁證就判定一個人有罪。

sentences.english: So that it likely is a artistic circumstantial evidence of the history of suffering of Yunnan Hui.
sentences.chinese: 因此，它很可以成爲雲南回族受難史的一個藝術旁證。

sentences.english: Indeed, earlier probes had found circumstantial evidence of at least some ice there before.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，早期的探索就發現在那有冰的旁證。

definition: forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
to comment/a point by point commentary
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
